byGlass.name: Jean Collet Cremant de Bourgogne
byGlass.note: Bubbles and bread—the ultimate texture match.
byGlass.description: Dry and energetic with a fine mousse; features sharp green apple notes and a refreshing citrus finish.

midRange.name: Champagne Pierre Peters Blanc de Blancs
midRange.note: Elevates the simple bread with toasted brioche notes.
midRange.description: Bone-dry and chalky with high acidity. Expect elegant layers of lemon zest, white flowers, and a toasted almond finish.

exclusive.name: Champagne Pierre Peters L'esprit Grand Cru
exclusive.note: A vintage powerhouse to transform a snack into a celebration.
exclusive.description: A sophisticated, structured vintage Champagne. Offers intense minerality, ripe orchard fruit, and a creamy, lingering autolytic depth.

byGlass.name: Acham-Magin Riesling Trocken
byGlass.note: Crisp acidity to cut through the salt and smoke.
byGlass.description: Very dry and lean. It showcases electric acidity with classic notes of lime, wet stone, and a hint of petrol.

midRange.name: Rafael Palacios Godello
midRange.note: Spanish olives meet Spanish white; a perfect regional match.
midRange.description: Medium-bodied and dry. Balancing a waxy texture with bright acidity, it offers flavors of yellow plum and a distinct salty minerality.

exclusive.name: Selbach-Oster Zeltinger Zonnenuhr Auslese
exclusive.note: The slight sweetness plays beautifully against salty olives.
exclusive.description: Lusciously sweet yet balanced by piercing acidity. Rich honeyed apricot and tropical fruit notes with a clean, flinty backbone.

byGlass.name: E. Pira di Chiara Boschis Dolcetto Alba
byGlass.note: A juicy, purple-fruited red that cuts through the rich fat of the Iberico ham.
byGlass.description: Dry and medium-bodied with soft tannins. Dominated by black cherry and violet aromas with a refreshingly bitter almond finish.

midRange.name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
midRange.note: The tannins and acidity are the perfect 'cleaner' for high-quality cured meats.
midRange.description: Dry with firm, grippy tannins and high acidity. Displays complex notes of dried rose, tar, and crunchy red berries.

exclusive.name: Chateau Lanessan
exclusive.note: The earthy complexity of aged Bordeaux highlights the nutty flavors of Bellota-grade ham.
exclusive.description: Dry and well-structured with resolved tannins. Features savory cedar, tobacco leaf, and maturing blackcurrant flavors.

items.dish: Baked Camembert with tomato & vanilla compote and bread

byGlass.name: Acham-Magin Riesling Trocken
byGlass.note: Bright acidity to balance the gooey cheese and sweet vanilla compote.
byGlass.description: A laser-focused dry white. High acidity provides a palate-cleansing effect against rich fats, featuring green apple and citrus zest.

midRange.name: Domaine E. Guigal Côtes du Rhone Blanc
midRange.note: The floral Viognier notes mirror the aromatic vanilla in the compote.
midRange.description: Dry and medium-plus body. Highly aromatic with notes of apricot, white peach, and honeysuckle, offering a smooth, oily texture.

exclusive.name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
exclusive.note: A rich, textured white that stands up to the weight of baked cheese.
exclusive.description: Dry and full-bodied. A masterclass in balance, showing ripe pear, lemon curd, and a subtle, integrated oak spice.

byGlass.name: Champagne Pierre Peters
byGlass.note: Classic saline pairing for fresh shellfish.
byGlass.description: Brut and crystalline. Characterized by high tension, sea-spray salinity, and a sharp lime-driven finish.

midRange.name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
midRange.note: Chardonnay with enough citrus 'zing' for the dill and horseradish.
midRange.description: A vibrant, dry white with excellent concentration. Bright citrus acidity is layered over a rich, limestone-driven mineral core.

exclusive.name: Champagne Pierre Peters MAGNUM
exclusive.note: The finest bubbles for the finest start to your meal.
exclusive.description: Enhanced depth from magnum aging. Exceptional finesse with persistent bubbles, green apple, and a long, chalky mineral tail.

byGlass.name: Jean Collet Cremant de Bourgogne
byGlass.note: Creamy bubbles to match the Røros cream.
byGlass.description: Dry and festive. Features a creamy mouthfeel with notes of golden apple and freshly baked sourdough.

midRange.name: Champagne Pierre Peters
midRange.note: Blanc de Blancs highlights the delicate salinity of Løyrom.
midRange.description: Pure and focused. The high acidity and saline notes act as a perfect foil to the richness of the Røros cream.

exclusive.name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault Cassé Tete
exclusive.note: Rich enough to handle the cream and luxurious enough for caviar.
exclusive.description: Dry and opulent. Exhibits a beautiful tension between toasted hazelnut richness and a piercing, stony mineral finish.

items.dish: 2 croquettes with Bellota ham and cheese sauce

byGlass.name: Chavy Chouet Aligoté
byGlass.note: Zesty acidity cuts through the fried richness and cheese.
byGlass.description: Bone-dry and lean. Known for its high-toned acidity and zesty lemon-peel flavors, perfect for cutting through fried textures.

midRange.name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
midRange.note: Tannins to balance the fat and salt of the Bellota ham.
midRange.description: Dry with structured tannins. Shows bright red currant and sour cherry flavors with earthy undertones and a long finish.

exclusive.name: Chateau Ducru Beaucaillou, Le Petit Ducru
exclusive.note: A structured red that honors the intensity of aged Ibérico ham.
exclusive.description: Dry, full-bodied, and polished. Lush black fruit is framed by fine-grained tannins and elegant cedar spice.

byGlass.name: Glantenay Bourgogne Côte d'Or
byGlass.note: Delicate red fruit that won't overwhelm the raw beef.
byGlass.description: Dry and light-to-medium bodied. Silky tannins accompany flavors of wild strawberry, raspberry, and a soft forest-floor earthiness.

midRange.name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
midRange.note: Nebbiolo structure handles the salty Västerbotten cheese well.
midRange.description: A dry, high-acid red. Its tannin profile stands up to the protein of the beef, while offering complex floral and spicy aromatics.

exclusive.name: Cyprien Arlaud Vosne-Romanée
exclusive.note: A floral, silky Pinot Noir for the ultimate tartare experience.
exclusive.description: Dry, elegant, and ethereal. Boasts velvet tannins, deep red cherry fruit, and an exotic spice profile characteristic of Vosne.

items.dish: Cabbage salad, apple compote, spicy feta & yuzu

byGlass.name: Acham-Magin Riesling
byGlass.note: Riesling is the king of pairing with cabbage and yuzu acidity.
byGlass.description: Zesty and dry. The high acidity mirrors the yuzu, while the fruit profile complements the sweetness of the apple compote.

midRange.name: Domaine E. Guigal Côtes du Rhone Blanc
midRange.note: The Viognier in the blend tames the spice of the feta.
midRange.description: Medium-bodied with a round texture. Its floral apricot and peach flavors balance the heat of the spicy feta beautifully.

exclusive.name: Francois Carillon Chassagne Montrachet 1er Cru
exclusive.note: A complex white that mirrors the multi-layered flavors of this salad.
exclusive.description: Full-bodied and dry. Displays intense power, toasted nut notes, and a persistent citrus acidity that frames the rich fruit.

items.dish: Scallop from Hitra with creamy celery root sauce

byGlass.name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
byGlass.note: Round and buttery, matching the sauce's texture.
byGlass.description: Dry and texturally rich. Provides a creamy palate of yellow apple and lemon cream with a light mineral finish.

midRange.name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault
midRange.note: The golden standard for scallops in cream sauce.
midRange.description: Full-bodied and indulgent. Expect classic Meursault notes of hazelnut, buttered toast, and ripe stone fruit with balanced acidity.

exclusive.name: De Montille Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru
exclusive.description: Dry and monumental. Intense concentration of citrus, crushed stones, and white pepper with immense aging potential and length.

items.dish: Creamy orzo with langoustine, chili & lemon

byGlass.name: Domaine E. Guigal CdR Blanc
byGlass.note: Aromatic and round to balance the chili and shellfish.
byGlass.description: Soft and dry with low-to-medium acidity. Floral notes and honeyed stone fruits provide a soothing counterpoint to the chili heat.

midRange.name: Francois Carillon Puligny-Montrachet
midRange.note: Clean, linear acidity for the lemon and rich langoustine.
midRange.description: Precise and dry. Features high-definition notes of lemon zest and white peach, with a signature flinty, linear finish.

exclusive.name: Domaine Bonneau du Martray Corton-Charlemagne
exclusive.note: A legendary white for a standout seafood pasta.
exclusive.description: Regal and complex. A full-bodied white showing extraordinary depth of fruit, precise mineral tension, and a regal, spicy finish.

items.dish: Gratinated Cannelloni with beef cheek ragu

byGlass.name: Château Camino Salva
byGlass.note: Rustic Bordeaux that loves braised meat and cheese.
byGlass.description: Dry and medium-bodied. Offers classic dark fruit flavors with earthy, savory undertones and grippy tannins for the ragu.

midRange.name: Chateau Lanessan
midRange.note: Aged Bordeaux with softened tannins for the ragu.
midRange.description: Dry and elegant. The secondary notes of leather and forest floor are emerging, complementing the slow-cooked beef cheek.

exclusive.name: Chateau Ducru Beaucaillou
exclusive.note: Rare vintage excellence for a classic comfort dish.
exclusive.description: Dry, full-bodied, and profound. Exceptional structure with fully integrated tannins and a deep, complex bouquet of cassis and truffle.

items.dish: Mezzo Maniche with duck, artichoke, orange & 36-month aged Pecorino

byGlass.name: Reynaud Crozes-Hermitage Beaumont
byGlass.note: Peppery Syrah is the classic match for gamey duck and bitter artichoke.
byGlass.description: Dry and medium-plus body. Characterized by savory notes of black pepper, smoked meat, and dark bramble fruit.

midRange.name: Cavalotto Langhe Nebbiolo
midRange.note: The high tannins cut through the salt of the aged Pecorino and the richness of the duck.
midRange.description: Firm and dry. High tannin and acid provide the structural 'clout' needed to balance the intensity of the 36-month Pecorino.

exclusive.name: Cyprien Arlaud Vosne-Romanée
exclusive.note: An elegant, earthy red to mirror the complexity of orange zest and artichoke.
exclusive.description: Supple and dry. Its aromatic complexity of red berries and dried herbs matches the citrus and artichoke elements of the dish.

items.dish: Halibut with plum cream, butter sauce and Vongole

byGlass.name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
byGlass.note: Buttery Chardonnay for the plum and butter base.
byGlass.description: Dry and texturally generous. Provides enough weight to match the butter sauce while maintaining fresh acidity.

midRange.name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault
midRange.note: Classic Meursault richness for a heavy white fish.
midRange.description: Full-bodied with a nutty, buttery profile. The ripe fruit and oak integration complement the oily, rich nature of the halibut.

exclusive.name: Domaine Leflaive Puligny-Montrachet
exclusive.note: Unmatched purity and precision to highlight the Halibut.
exclusive.description: Dry and incredibly elegant. Offers crystalline purity, white blossom aromas, and a finish of immense focus and length.

items.dish: Grilled Turbot on the bone with shellfish sauce

byGlass.name: Dominique Lafon Bourgogne Blanc
byGlass.note: A noble fish requires a noble white; the weight matches the shellfish sauce.
byGlass.description: A dry, high-quality white with a silky mouthfeel and clean citrus acidity to lift the shellfish sauce.

midRange.name: Chavy-Chouet Meursault Cassé Tete
midRange.note: Intense minerality and butter notes to complement the grilled turbot.
midRange.description: Full-bodied and structured. The smoky minerality from the soil echoes the char of the grilled fish perfectly.

exclusive.name: Domaine de Montille Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru
exclusive.note: A legendary Grand Cru pairing for the most premium seafood on the menu.
exclusive.description: Dry and powerful. A wine of great density and breadth, with layers of orchard fruit, spice, and crushed rock.

items.dish: Entrecôte with Café de Paris sauce

byGlass.name: Reynaud Crozes-Hermitage Beaumont
byGlass.note: Peppery Syrah for the herb-heavy sauce.
byGlass.description: Dry and medium-plus body. Bold black pepper and olive notes harmonize with the herbaceous Café de Paris butter.

midRange.name: Chateau Lanessan
midRange.note: Earthy, structured Cabernet blend for the ribeye fat.
midRange.description: Dry and firm. Its tannic structure and dark fruit depth provide the necessary backbone for the rich entrecôte fat.

exclusive.name: Cyprien Arlaud Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru
exclusive.note: A muscular red for the most serious of steaks.
exclusive.description: Dry and powerful for Pinot Noir. A Grand Cru with exceptional concentration, depth of red fruit, and refined but present tannins.

items.dish: Omaha Entrecôte, sauce au poivre & sauce Cafe de Paris

byGlass.name: Château Camino Salva
byGlass.note: A classic Haut-Médoc to stand up to the bold pepper and butter sauces.
byGlass.description: Dry, tannic, and dark. The classic blackcurrant and cedar profile is a robust match for the peppery sauce.

midRange.name: Reynaud Crozes-Hermitage Beaumont
midRange.note: The spicy, black-pepper profile of Syrah is the natural partner for steak au poivre.
midRange.description: Vibrant and dry. Features smoky aromatics and spicy black fruit that thrives alongside peppercorn-based sauces.

exclusive.name: Chateau Ducru Beaucaillou
exclusive.note: An aged powerhouse with soft tannins and immense depth for a shared steak experience.
exclusive.description: A masterpiece of dry, mature Bordeaux. Extraordinary depth, silky tannins, and complex notes of graphite, cedar, and dried fruit.

byGlass.name: Glantenay Bourgogne Côte d'Or
byGlass.note: Soft Pinot Noir to cut through the foie gras.
byGlass.description: Dry and graceful. Its vibrant red acidity helps refresh the palate between rich bites of tenderloin and foie gras.

midRange.name: Le Petit Ducru Beaucaillou
midRange.note: A structured Saint-Julien to handle the truffle and fat.
midRange.description: Full-bodied and dry. Polished tannins and concentrated dark fruit offer the luxury required for this classic French dish.

exclusive.name: Clos de La Roche Grand Cru
exclusive.note: Opulent, intense, and a perfect match for truffle.
exclusive.description: Dry, rich, and gamey. A powerful Grand Cru showing profound earthy complexity and a massive, silk-laden finish.
